div.p: Bullinger's notes on the person of Christ.
If when the Lord says: I am with you all the days of your life, he means both and the whole of himself, not just power, not just life, not just spirit, explain these things to me:
We will come and make our home with him. I am in the midst of them.
Today you will be with me in paradise. And they placed him in the tomb.
You insist: μεθ' ὑμῶν (Matthew, last chapter) I insist αξ' ὑμῶν (Acts 1.)

These works of God do not arrogate to themselves nor do they make instruments, and yet they do something in the business of salvation: for they are not in vain. However, they do what God wanted them to do.

He did not impart to the apostles the righteousness of faith and exercises or aids of faith equally. For the law is a tutor, but it does not justify for that reason: circumcision, but it does not justify for that reason. However, faith justifies. The sacraments are aids of faith.
I hope we are already in agreement on these things and hereafter the same about the sacraments. [...] (the rest is cut off.)
